developer_portals.title: Developer Landing Pages
developer_portals.long_description: A dedicated developer portal or landing page can serve as a way to keep the homepage non technical and providing with all the dedication developers need to make a decision.

first_login.title: First-time use dashboards
first_login.description: Look and feel of dashboards on first login
first_login.long_description: Providing a custom first-time use experience right after a developer signs up can help with user activation and retention.

confirmation_emails.title: Confirmation Emails
confirmation_emails.description: Emails sent out to confirm the user's email address
confirmation_emails.long_description: Confirmation emails are sent out to confirm the user's email address.

welcome_emails.title: Welcome Emails
welcome_emails.description: Emails sent out to developers after signup
welcome_emails.long_description: Welcome emails are an essential tool for managing user retention. When people sign up and don't complete a first integration a simple welcome email can often bring people back to your product on a later moment.

home_pages.title: Home Pages
home_pages.long_description: The initial home page is often catered to fit the needs of developers and other interested parties. It therefore has to strike a balance to introduce both technical and non technical people to the product at offer.
